meanings.definition: Enologists: experts in the field of wine and winemaking.
meanings.sent1: Enologists are skilled professionals who understand all about making wine.
meanings.sent2: The enologists at the vineyard are responsible for ensuring the quality of the wine.
meanings.sent3: The enologists had a grape-stomping contest to see who could make the best wine.
meanings.sent4: She was a magician in the kitchen, transforming grapes into liquid gold like an enologist.
meanings.sent5: The enologists' knowledge of wine is as deep as the cellars they work in.

meanings.definition: Enologists: those who study and analyze the science of wine production.
meanings.sent1: The enologists carefully examine each step of the winemaking process to improve it.
meanings.sent2: Enologists use scientific methods to understand the fermentation of grapes into wine.
meanings.sent3: The enologists joked that they could turn water into wine with their expertise.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in blending flavors made her the enologist of the family gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The enologists' dedication to wine science is as strong as the aroma of a fine vintage.
